questionText: Global warming is the ongoing rise in average surface temperature.
author: oriFake

questionText: There is evidence that global warming is due to human emission of greenhouse gases.
author: oriFake

questionText: Carbon monoxide, methane and nitrous oxide are produced by burning of coal, oil, and gas.
author: oriFake

questionText: Greenhouse gases trap heat in the atmosphere.
author: oriFake

questionText: Warming can cause ocean warming and rising seas.
author: oriFake

questionText: Harbinger events are events that foreshadow impacts likely to become more frequent and widespread with continued warming.
author: oriFake

questionText: Global warming can cause changes to plant and animal populations.
author: oriFake

questionText: Changes in ocean currents have resulted in a shortage of feed for seals and penguins.
author: oriFake

questionText: It has been estimated that one-third of all species may be lost by the end of this century.
author: oriFake

questionText: Increased sea levels could threaten many low-lying coastal cities.
author: oriFake

questionText: It can endanger human health by causing food and water shortages.
author: oriFake

questionText: There will be increased risk of heart disease.
author: oriFake

questionText: With global warming comes more heat stress.
author: oriFake

questionText: Heavier rainfall in Africa has caused the spread of malaria.
author: oriFake

questionText: Warming in the Arctic region has thinned upper Arctic ice.
author: oriFake

questionText: The tundra permafrost is thawing, and some sub-arctic plants are migrating north.
author: oriFake
